name: touch
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put your hand or another part of your body lightly onto and off something or someone

example.eg: That paint is wet - don't touch (it).
example.egtrans: 那块油漆没干——别碰（它）。

example.eg: He touched the girl on the arm to get her attention.
example.egtrans: 他碰了碰女孩的胳膊以引起她的注意。

example.eg: The boy touched the worm with (= using, in his hand) a twig.
example.egtrans: 小孩用小树枝碰了碰虫子。

example.eg: The setting sun touched the trees with red (= made them appear red for a short time).
example.egtrans: 落日的余晖染红了树林。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of two or more things) to be so close together that there is no space between; to be in contact
trans_examp.trans_cn: （两个或两个以上的物品）接触

example.eg: He fell asleep as soon as his head touched the pillow.
example.egtrans: 他头一沾枕头就睡着了。

example.eg: She pushed the two bookcases together until they touched/were touching.
example.egtrans: 她把两个书柜推到一起。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to harm someone, or use or damage something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 伤害（某人）；使用（某物）；破坏（某物）

example.eg: Please don't touch any of my stuff while I'm away.
example.egtrans: 我不在时候请不要碰我的东西。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (usually used in negative sentences) to eat or drink something

example.eg: They didn't touch any of the food we left for them.
example.egtrans: 我们留下来给他们的食物，他们一点也没碰。

example.eg: Honestly, I haven't touched a drop (= drunk any alcohol) all night.
example.egtrans: 老实说，我整晚滴酒未沾。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to influence someone or something emotionally, or cause feelings of sympathy in someone

example.eg: Tragedy touched their lives when their son was 16.
example.egtrans: 他们儿子16岁那年，他们的生活中发生了悲剧。

example.eg: The TV report about the children's work for charity touched thousands of people's hearts.
example.egtrans: 电视上报道的孩子们为慈善团体所做的事令成千上万的人深受触动。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (usually used in negative sentences) to have or reach the same standard (= level of quality) as someone or something

example.eg: Her novels can't touch (= are not as good as) those of her sister.
example.egtrans: 她的小说不及她姐姐的好。

example.eg: There's no one to touch him as an illustrator of children's books.
example.egtrans: 在为儿童读物创作插图方面，没人比他画得好。

name: touch
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: "Would you like milk?" "Just a touch."
example.egtrans: “你要牛奶吗？”“只要一点儿。”

example.eg: There was a touch of irony/humour in her voice.
example.egtrans: 她的话音中带着点儿讽刺／幽默的意味。

trans_examp.trans_en: To show that an illness is not too serious, you can say you have had a touch of it.

example.eg: I had a touch of flu/hay fever.
example.egtrans: 我得了轻度流感／枯草热。

trans_examp.trans_en: a small addition or detail that makes something better

example.eg: The speech had several comic touches.
example.egtrans: 这一演讲有几分滑稽色彩。

example.eg: Using a sailing ship as the company logo was a touch of genius (= a good/clever idea or action).
example.egtrans: 用大帆船作公司的标志真是个天才的想法。

example.eg: The flowers on the table provided the finishing touch.
example.egtrans: 桌上的花是最后一道点缀。

example.eg: The weather has turned a touch too cold for my liking.
example.egtrans: 天气变得有点儿凉，我不太喜欢。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability to know what something is like by feeling it with the fingers

example.eg: the sense of touch
example.egtrans: 触觉

example.eg: I found the right coin in the dark by touch.
example.egtrans: 我在黑暗中摸索着找对了硬币。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used after an adjective to express how something feels when you put your hand on it

example.eg: The material was soft to the touch.
example.egtrans: 这块布料摸起来很柔软。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quick, light movement of one thing, especially a hand, onto and off another thing

example.eg: I felt a cold touch on my arm.
example.egtrans: 我感到有什么冰凉的东西碰到了我的胳膊。

example.eg: At a/the touch of a button, the door opened.
example.egtrans: 一碰按钮，门就开了。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

phrase.phrase_title: be, get, keep, etc. in touch

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to communicate or continue to communicate with someone by using a phone or writing to them

example.eg: Are you still in touch with any of your old school friends?
example.egtrans: 你还和以前学生时代的老朋友有联系吗？

example.eg: Jen and I never kept in touch after college.
example.egtrans: 我和简大学毕业后就没有联系过。

example.eg: We're in close touch with our office in Spain.
example.egtrans: 我们与西班牙的办事处有密切的联系。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to stop communicating with someone, usually because they do not live near you now

example.eg: We lost touch over the years.
example.egtrans: 我们这些年失去了联系。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an ability to do things in the stated, especially positive, way

example.eg: He has a deft touch with tricky painting jobs.
example.egtrans: 他很善于做复杂的油漆活。

example.eg: She gave the job her own special/magic/professional/personal touch.
example.egtrans: 这项工作展现了她独特／神奇／专业／个人的才能。

example.eg: I admire her lightness/sureness of touch as a cook.
example.egtrans: 我欣赏她做厨师的精细／踏实劲儿。

example.eg: He used to be a good writer but I think he's losing his touch.
example.egtrans: 他曾经是个好作家，但我觉得他的创作能力正在下降。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports such as football, a player's ability to control the ball and make it do what they want, or an occasion when a player controls the ball with their foot
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球等体育中）触球能力；触球

example.eg: Nicolas Anelka squandered the chance to score when his touch let him down in front of goal.
example.egtrans: 尼古拉·安内尔卡在球门前触球不当，浪费了一次进球机会。

example.eg: Hazard took several touches before crossing.
example.egtrans: 哈扎德触了好几次球之后把球传中。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the area outside either of the long edges of the space on which football and rugby are played
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球及类似体育运动的）边线以外区域

example.eg: Playing for safety, he kicked the ball into touch.
example.egtrans: 为了安全起见，他把球踢出了界外。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you are in touch/out of touch with a subject, activity, or situation, your knowledge about it is recent/not recent.

example.eg: He's not really in touch with what young people are interested in.
example.egtrans: 他并不真正了解年轻人现在对什么感兴趣。

example.eg: I didn't see any news all the time I was on holiday, so I'm completely out of touch.
example.egtrans: 我在度假期间一直都没有看新闻，所以现在对外界一无所知。
